did.unittitle: Bank of the United States minute book

bioghist.p: The Second Bank of the United States was located in Philadelphia and chartered in 1816, five years after the expiration of the First Bank of the United States. It was founded during the administration of President James Madison in an attempt to stabilize the currency. The Bank served as the repository for Federal funds until 1836, when its charter expired after President Andrew Jackson refused to recharter it due to a dispute with the Bank's president, Nicholas Biddle. The Bank then operated as a private institution until it went defunct in 1841.

scopecontent.p: This volume contains the rough minutes from June 1841 to January 1842 of the Trustees for Circulation and Deposits of the Bank of the United States. The entries are nearly daily, and discuss receipt of correspondence, appointment of agents, recovery of debts, and investments held by the bank.
